name: Would I Lie to You? Part 2 Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text:
I say that human fingernails grow faster that toenails.
Am I telling the truth or a falsehood?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Your fingernails grow nearly 4 times faster than your toenails.

questions.text: One of these statements is NOT true, but which one?
questions.correct: An adult dragonfly lives for just one day.
options: The eye of an ostrich is larger than its brain.
Owls are one of the few birds that can see the colour blue.
questions.explanation:
An adult dragonfly lives for just one day.

	Adult dragonflies have a lifespan of between 7 to 56 days. Most dragonflies don't live to die from old age, however. Most will fall to predation and to damage caused to their delicate wings.

questions.text:
Is this a true statement? 
"The Pony Express company owned more than 6,000 ponies."
questions.explanation:
no.

	In fact, the Pony Express company had no ponies... just horses!

questions.text: I say "K" is the least used letter in English writing, but am I lying?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	While "Q, X & Z" are the least used letters in English writing, the letter "E" is the most often used.

questions.text:
Is this statement true or false?
"Most windmills turn in a anti-clockwise (counter-clockwise)direction."
questions.explanation:
True.

	Most windmills turn in an anti-clockwise (counter-clockwise) direction. An exception are the windmills in Ireland!

questions.text: Three of these statements are true - but which one is the fib?
questions.correct: A shrimp's heart is in its tail.
options: A lungfish can live up to four years out of water.
Finches practice their songs while sleeping.
Dogs can hear sounds that humans cannot.
questions.explanation:
A shrimp's heart is in its tail.

	A shrimp's heart is found in its head... not its tail. The other three statements are true!

questions.text:
Am I telling the truth in this statement?
"In Da Vinci's painting, the Mona Lisa has no eyebrows."
questions.explanation:
yes.

	The Mona Lisa has no eyebrows, as it was the fashion in Renaissance Florence to shave them off. Leonardo Da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa in 1506.

questions.text: One of these statements is a lie, but which one?
options: Killer whales slap fish to capture them.
A male moth can smell a female from seven miles away.
A blue whale's heart can beat as low as just nine times a minute.
questions.explanation:
Dolphins never sleep.

	Dolphins do sleep... but they keep one eye open!

questions.text:
Is this statement true or false?
"A newborn baby has fewer bones than an adult."
questions.explanation:
False.

	A baby is born with 300 bones, but when you get to be an adult, you have only 206.

questions.text: And finally, which of these statements is a lie?
questions.correct: A giraffe can roar like a lion.
options: A goat's eyes have rectangular pupils.
Goldfish were once a traditional first wedding anniversary gift.
Each day a cow produces 200 times more gas than a human.
questions.explanation:
A giraffe can roar like a lion.

	Giraffes can snort like a pig, moo like a cow, grunt like a bull... but they cannot roar like a lion! Information from "funology.com" and "strangefacts.com".
